column1: Summary of Quick Sort Vs Merge Sort

column5: When memory is limited and input size is moderate
column6: Embedded systems like Car HUDs or smaller devices

column5: When you need external sorting and strong stability
column6: Large Data sets especially on external hard drives or other disks

column1: Some of the differences between the to algorithms is the quick sort divides the array into smaller partitions around a arbitrary pivot which can lead to instability in the sort.  The merge sort always splits the array in equal halves which allows for consistent performaces but requires larger memory usage.
